018package org.opengis.filter;
019
020import org.opengis.util.CodeList;
021import org.opengis.annotation.UML;
022import org.opengis.geoapi.internal.Vocabulary;
023
024import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.CONDITIONAL;
025import static org.opengis.annotation.Specification.ISO_19143;
026
027
028/**
029 * Nature of the spatial operation between two geometries.
030 *
031 * @author  Chris Dillard (SYS Technologies)
032 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (Geomatys)
033 * @version 3.1
034 * @since   3.1
035 */
036@Vocabulary(capacity=9)
037@UML(identifier="SpatialOperatorName", specification=ISO_19143)
038public final class SpatialOperatorName extends CodeList<SpatialOperatorName> {
039    /**
040     * Serial number for compatibility with different versions.
041     */
042    private static final long serialVersionUID = -5467041303033565459L;
043
044    /**
045     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} when the bounding box of the feature's geometry
046     * interacts with the bounding box provided in the filter properties.
047     * The geometry is given by the first expression and the bounding box
048     * is the envelope given by the second expression.
049     *
050     * <p>The {@code BBOX} operation is defined as a convenient and more compact way of
051     * expressing the very common bounding box constraint based on the envelope geometry.
052     * It is equivalent to the spatial operation <code>NOT {@linkplain #DISJOINT}</code>
053     * meaning that the {@code BBOX} operator identifies all geometries that spatially
054     * interact with the box.</p>
055     *
056     * <p>An implementation may choose to throw an exception if one attempts to test
057     * features that are in a different SRS than the SRS contained in the filter.</p>
058     */
059    @UML(identifier="BBOX", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
060    public static final SpatialOperatorName BBOX = new SpatialOperatorName("BBOX");
061
062    /**
063     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the geometry of the two operands are equal.
064     */
065    @UML(identifier="Equals", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
066    public static final SpatialOperatorName EQUALS = new SpatialOperatorName("EQUALS");
067
068    /**
069     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the first operand is disjoint from the second.
070     * "Disjoint" shall be interpreted in the sense defined in the OGC Simple Features specification.
071     */
072    @UML(identifier="Disjoint", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
073    public static final SpatialOperatorName DISJOINT = new SpatialOperatorName("DISJOINT");
074
075    /**
076     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the two geometric operands intersect.
077     */
078    @UML(identifier="Intersects", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
079    public static final SpatialOperatorName INTERSECTS = new SpatialOperatorName("INTERSECTS");
080
081    /**
082     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the two geometric operands touch, but do not overlap.
083     */
084    @UML(identifier="Touches", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
085    public static final SpatialOperatorName TOUCHES = new SpatialOperatorName("TOUCHES");
086
087    /**
088     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the first geometric operand crosses the second.
089     * "Cross" shall be interpreted in the sense defined by the OGC Simple Features specification.
090     */
091    @UML(identifier="Crosses", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
092    public static final SpatialOperatorName CROSSES = new SpatialOperatorName("CROSSES");
093
094    /**
095     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the first geometric operand is completely
096     * contained by the constant geometric operand.
097     */
098    @UML(identifier="Within", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
099    public static final SpatialOperatorName WITHIN = new SpatialOperatorName("WITHIN");
100
101    /**
102     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the first geometric operand contains the second.
103     */
104    @UML(identifier="Contains", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
105    public static final SpatialOperatorName CONTAINS = new SpatialOperatorName("CONTAINS");
106
107    /**
108     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the interior of the first geometric operand
109     * somewhere overlaps the interior of the second geometric operand.
110     */
111    @UML(identifier="Overlaps", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
112    public static final SpatialOperatorName OVERLAPS = new SpatialOperatorName("OVERLAPS");
113
114    /**
115     * Constructs an element of the given name.
116     *
117     * @param name  the name of the new element. This name shall not be in use by another element of this type.
118     */
119    private SpatialOperatorName(final String name) {
120        super(name);
121    }
122
123    /**
124     * Returns the list of {@code SpatialOperatorName}s.
125     *
126     * @return the list of codes declared in the current JVM.
127     */
128    public static SpatialOperatorName[] values() {
129        return values(SpatialOperatorName.class);
130    }
131
132    /**
133     * Returns the list of codes of the same kind as this code list element.
134     * Invoking this method is equivalent to invoking {@link #values()}, except that
135     * this method can be invoked on an instance of the parent {@code CodeList} class.
136     *
137     * @return all code {@linkplain #values() values} for this code list.
138     */
139    @Override
140    public SpatialOperatorName[] family() {
141        return values();
142    }
143
144    /**
145     * Returns the spatial operator that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.
146     * This methods returns the first instance (in declaration order) for which the {@linkplain #name() name}
147     * is {@linkplain String#equalsIgnoreCase(String) equals, ignoring case}, to the given name.
148     * If no existing instance is found, then a new one is created for the given name.
149     *
150     * @param  code  the name of the code to fetch or to create.
151     * @return a code matching the given name.
152     */
153    public static SpatialOperatorName valueOf(String code) {
154        return valueOf(SpatialOperatorName.class, code, SpatialOperatorName::new).get();
155    }
156}
